2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_3sfca.long_name: 2 year college access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_3sfca.short_description: Index of 3-year college accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_3sfca.long_description: 2-year college access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of college capacity per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which an institution is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for 2-year college (whole population in an area served by the institution) and supply is the total number of students enrolled in a year (graduate and undergraduate).
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_3sfca.statement: The 2-year college accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.long_name: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.short_description: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.long_description: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.statement: On average {value} of 3rd graders pass reading in {features.name}.

civilian_employment_rate:employment_rate.short_description: Population self-reported as employed divided by total civilian workforce population.
civilian_employment_rate:employment_rate.long_description: Population self-reported as employed divided by total civilian workforce population. Based on American Community Survey Table B23025 ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
civilian_employment_rate:employment_rate.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} is employed.

community_college_computer_sciences_fca:.short_name: Community college computer science program access score
community_college_computer_sciences_fca:.long_name: Community college computer science program access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
community_college_computer_sciences_fca:.short_description: Index of community college computer science program accessibility based on supply and demand of programs
community_college_computer_sciences_fca:.long_description: Community college computer science program access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of programs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a program is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for programs (adult population) and the supply is the capacity of programs (number of seats).
community_college_computer_sciences_fca:.statement: The community college computer science program accessibility score in {features.name} is {value}.

community_college_engineering_fca:3sfca_.short_name: Community college engineering program access score
community_college_engineering_fca:3sfca_.long_name: Community college engineering program access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
community_college_engineering_fca:3sfca_.short_description: Index of community college engineering program accessibility based on supply and demand of programs
community_college_engineering_fca:3sfca_.long_description: Community college engineering program access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of programs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a program is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for programs (adult population) and the supply is the capacity of programs (number of seats).
community_college_engineering_fca:3sfca_.statement: The community college engineering program accessibility score in {features.name} is {value}.

community_college_engineering_related_fc.short_name: Community college engineering-related program access score
community_college_engineering_related_fc.long_name: Community college engineering-related program access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
community_college_engineering_related_fc.short_description: Index of community college engineering-related program accessibility based on supply and demand of programs
community_college_engineering_related_fc.long_description: Community college engineering-related program access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of programs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a program is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for programs (adult population) and the supply is the capacity of programs (number of seats).
community_college_engineering_related_fc.statement: The community college engineering-related program accessibility score in {features.name} is {value}.

daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.

daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.long_name: Day care access score (3-step floating catchment area)
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.short_description: Index of day care accessibility based on supply of and demand for providers
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.long_description: Day care access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.statement: The daycare accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.long_name: Day care access by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

dei_index:norm_dei.short_description: Digital Equity Index captures the relative equity of digital access, with 0 being a score of relative equity and 100 being relative inequity.
dei_index:norm_dei.long_description: The Digital Equity Index (DEI) is a composite variable indicating the degree of broadband equity as it relates to adoption, accessibility, and infrastructure. It ranges from 0 to 100, where 100 indicates the most equitable broadband access. The DEI is constructed at the Census tract level and is composed of the following variables: percent of the population under 65 years of age, percent of the population with at least a high school education, percent of the population with income below the poverty level, percent of the population without a disability, the ratio between the share of homes making $75,000 or more per year with internet and the share of homes making less than $35,000 per year without internet, percent of the population with at least one computer, percent of the population with internet access, percent of the population that is low income (less than 30% of HUD Area Median Family Income) and have a housing cost burden over 30%, and average download speeds, upload speeds, and latency from Ookla speed tests.
dei_index:norm_dei.statement: The Digital Equity Index for {features.name} is {value}.

access_scores_dentists:dent_cnt.short_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations
access_scores_dentists:dent_cnt.long_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.

access_scores_dentists:dent_e2sfca.long_name: Dental care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
access_scores_dentists:dent_e2sfca.short_description: Index of dental care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
access_scores_dentists:dent_e2sfca.long_description: Dental care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
access_scores_dentists:dent_e2sfca.statement: The dental care access score for {features.name} is {value}.

download_speeds:download.short_description: Average download speed for internet connection in MB/s
download_speeds:download.long_description: The average download speed for internet users' connections who performed a speed check using Ookla. Speeds are reported in MB/s. A speed of 100 MB/s is considered adequate for school work, video calling etc.
download_speeds:download.statement: The average download speed for internet connections in {features.name} is {value}.

drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.long_name: 2-year college access by median drive time to the five closest colleges in minutes
drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest 2-year colleges from centroid of selected region
drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest 2-year colleges from centroid of selected region. Address data was collected from the National Center for Education Statistics (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.statement: The median drive time to the five closest 2-year colleges to {features.name} is {value}.

drive_times_nearest_trade_schools:median.long_name: Trade school access by median drive time to the five closest schools in minutes
drive_times_nearest_trade_schools:median.short_description: Mean drive time (minutes) to the five closest trade schools from centroid of selected region
drive_times_nearest_trade_schools:median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest trade schools from centroid of selected region. Address data was collected from the National Center for Education Statistics (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
drive_times_nearest_trade_schools:median.statement: The median drive time to the five closest trade schools to {features.name} is {value}.

drug_overdose_ed_visits:avg_overdose_per.long_name: Emergency department visits for drug overdose rate per 100,000 residents
drug_overdose_ed_visits:avg_overdose_per.short_description: Average emergency department visits for drug overdose per 100,000 residents.

access_scores_ems:ems_near_10_median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest emergency medical services facilities. access_scores_ems:ems_3sfca.long_name: Emergency medical services access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
access_scores_ems:ems_3sfca.short_description: Index of emergency medical services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
access_scores_ems:ems_3sfca.long_description: Emergency medical services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). access_scores_ems:ems_cnt.short_description: Count of emergency medical services facilities based on facility locations

access_scores_ems:ems_cnt.statement: There are {value} emergency medical services facilities in {features.name}.

food_insecurity_and_cost:Child_Food_Inse.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
food_insecurity_and_cost:Child_Food_Inse.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Child_Food_Inse.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

food_insecurity_and_cost:Cost_Per_Meal.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Cost_Per_Meal.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Cost_Per_Meal.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

food_insecurity_and_cost:Food_Insecurity.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Food_Insecurity.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Food_Insecurity.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

food_insecurity_and_cost:Num_Child_Food_.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
food_insecurity_and_cost:Num_Child_Food_.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Num_Child_Food_.statement: The population of food insecure children in {features.name} is {value}.

health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.short_description: Health literacy estimate captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.long_description: The health literacy estimate captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy estimate is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.statement: The health literacy estimate for {features.name} is {value}.

substance_access_scores:subs_3sfca.long_description: Substance use/behavioral health services access score based on 3-step  floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
substance_access_scores:subs_3sfca.statement: The substance use/behavioral health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

substance_access_scores:subs_cnt.long_name: Access to substance use/behavioral health  by count
substance_access_scores:subs_cnt.short_description: Count of substance use/behavioral health facilities based on facility locations
substance_access_scores:subs_cnt.long_description: Count of substance use/behavioral health facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.
substance_access_scores:subs_cnt.statement: There are {value} substance use facilities in {features.name}.

trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.long_name: Trade school access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.short_description: Index of trade school accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.long_description: Trade school access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of trade school capacity per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which an institution is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for trade schools (whole population in an area served by the institution) and supply is the total number of students enrolled in a year (undergraduate).
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.statement: The trade school accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

earnings_per_job:earnings_per_job.long_description: Earnings per job is calculated based on the GDP and Personal Income table from the Bureau of Economic Analysis.

broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.short_description: Percentage of households self-reported to have a broadband internet connection (any type of internet other than a dial-up)
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_description: Percentage of households self-reported to have a broadband internet connection. Broadband internet is defined as any type of internet other than a dial-up. Based on American Community Survey Table B28002 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.statement: {value} of households in {features.name} have a broadband connection.

broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.short_name: Households with cable, fiber optic, or DSL
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_name: Percentage of households with a high speed internet service (cable, fiber optic, or DSL)
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.short_description: Percentage of households self-reported to have a high speed internet service (cable, fiber optic, or DSL)
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_description: Percentage of households self-reported to have a high speed internet service. A high speed internet service is defined as a cable, fiber optic, or DSL internet connection. Based on American Community Survey Table B28002 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.statement: {value} of households in {features.name} have a cable, fiber optic, or DSL internet connection.

broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_name: Percentage of households without a computer
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.short_description: Percentage of households self-reported to not have a computer or device at home
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_description: Percentage of the households self-reported to not have a computer or device at home. Based on American Community Survey Table B28002 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.statement: {value} of households in {features.name} do not have a computer or device.

broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_name: Percentage of households without internet access
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.short_description: Percentage of households self-reported to not have internet access at home
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.long_description: Percentage of households self-reported to not have internet access at home. Based on American Community Survey Table B28002 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
broadband_withoutint_compdev:perc_hh_wit.statement: {value} of households in {features.name} do not have internet access.
